intro: Heliophila liniflora, commonly known as narrow-leaved heliophyte, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Heliophila liniflora is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used historically in herbal medicine.
